dispositions.title: Socially Conscious
dispositions.definition: Actively seeks to improve community wellbeing and recognises the civic responsibilities shared by all citizens.
iCan: I can notice when voices are missing and invite them in.
I can propose actions that strengthen fairness and inclusion.
I can explain how civic systems impact people differently.

activities.title: Community Pulse Check
objectives: Collect evidence about how school or community members experience a civic issue.
Identify patterns that suggest where support or action is needed.
steps: Students review survey or interview snippets capturing community viewpoints.
Teams sort responses into themes and note urgent concerns.
Class creates a pulse chart showing which issues need immediate attention.
successCriteria: I can summarise what our data says about community needs.
I can recommend one action that responds to what people asked for.

activities.title: Equity Walk
objectives: Evaluate how learning spaces and processes support equitable participation.
Co-design improvements that increase access and belonging.
steps: Pairs audit a learning space or online platform using an equity checklist.
Students record barriers that might prevent participation.
Teams pitch low-cost changes and prioritise ideas for implementation.
successCriteria: I can describe evidence of equitable and inequitable participation.
I can suggest a change that improves access for a specific group.

dispositions.title: Discerning
dispositions.definition: Evaluates information critically, questions assumptions and makes reasoned judgments before acting.
iCan: I can test evidence for credibility and bias.
I can compare perspectives before deciding what to believe.
I can justify a decision with transparent criteria.

activities.title: Source Detective
objectives: Interrogate multiple sources covering the same story for bias and reliability.
Construct evidence statements that acknowledge limitations.
steps: Students rotate through stations with contrasting articles and posts.
Teams apply a credibility rubric and record anomalies or missing context.
Each team crafts an evidence statement that balances the perspectives.
successCriteria: I can explain how bias shows up in a source.
I can state whether I would trust a source and why.

activities.title: Algorithm Unboxed
objectives: Analyse how recommendation algorithms shape what information citizens see.
Develop strategies to diversify personal media feeds.
steps: Students compare screenshots of their feeds and identify patterns.
Mini-lesson on filter bubbles and civic implications.
Learners design a media remix plan with intentional sources.
successCriteria: I can describe how an algorithm influenced my information diet.
I can list steps to broaden the perspectives I encounter online.

dispositions.title: Principled
dispositions.definition: Acts with integrity, respects diverse perspectives and makes ethical choices when participating civically.
iCan: I can explain how my values shape my decisions.
I can listen actively and respond with respect, even when we disagree.
I can evaluate civic actions for ethical impact.

activities.title: Ethical Debate Circle
objectives: Examine a civic dilemma from multiple stakeholder perspectives.
Practise protocols for respectful disagreement and consensus building.
steps: Students read a dilemma briefing and adopt stakeholder roles.
Circle discussion using speaking tokens and reflection prompts.
Groups craft a consensus statement noting ethical trade-offs.
successCriteria: I can articulate a perspective different from my own fairly.
I can describe the ethical implications of the decision we reached.

activities.title: Civic Action Reflection Studio
objectives: Evaluate a recent civic action for impact and alignment with class values.
Set personal commitments for principled participation in future contexts.
steps: Students review evidence from their civic action and annotate alignment with values.
Individuals write a principled participation pledge with specific behaviours.
Peer coaching conversation to refine commitments and accountability steps.
successCriteria: I can connect my civic action to shared democratic values.
I can name a behaviour I will adopt to stay principled when acting.
